name: Hampton Inn & Suites Williamsburg Historic District

reviews.text: We just returned from this Hampton Inn and needless to say I was pretty worried given the last review about the infection from the hot tub. I made sure my kids did not go in the hot tub (I usually don't let them anyway) but there were plenty of kids going in and then jumping in the pool. All three of my kids were in the pool every one of our 4 days there for at least 30 minutes each time and none of them developed any kind of rash. The pool water did look a bit cloudy to me on the last day but didn't seem to bother the kids.
reviews.title: No problem with pool

reviews.text: I did let the front desk know about what I had read here on the site and they said they had no record of any complaint made about a skin infection developing from a recent use of the hot tub. The girl at the front desk assured me that the pool is tested regulary and a monthly health inspection is done by the county. I will also say though that the white board in the pool area which lists the Ph level never looked like it was changed and the date at the top never changed either, it remained at 4/ ___/08 with no middle day filled in.
reviews.title: Beware of Hot Tub

likes.disliked: — poorly maintained pool and hot tub water

reviews.text: As for the hotel, it is very nice, brand new, and the room was nice and big (a studio suite with 2 queens and a sleeper sofa). It was not the greatest ever and not especially cheap either ($150 on th weekend with AAA). Our bathroom lock was broken when we got there( they did promplty replace the lock) and the room showed some wear and tear (black scuff marks on the wall). I also didn't like the position of the one TV in the room which was really hard for everyone to see once we were all in bed without turning it to face the beds (then the person on the sofa couldn't see it). I much prefer the set up of an embassy suites with 2 tvs, however we did go by the Williamsburg embassy suites and did not care for it (at least in the lobby area) Not what you would expect from an embassy suites, no big atrium, small lobby. DId not look at the rooms though.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel
GREAT family hotel!!
reviews.text: The last thing is that I did not care for the location of this Hampton. It is a bit out of the way for my tastes. It was in a definitly older section surrounded by older motels. It was close to the visitors center though by car, but for us it would have been better to be on Richmond Road nearer all the shops and the restaurants.

SInce it rained every day we did a lot of driving around and I think that next time I might check out the Hilton Garden Inn on Richmond Road. It looked very nice from the outside and I liked the location right on Richmond Road but set back from the street. The other Hampton is right on the road and looked old to me. They are also building a brand new Hampton Inn and Suites right across from the Holiday Inn on ?Bypass Road? I think. This location would also be better than the one we stayed at since it is closer in to town.
reviews.title: Loved It!!!

likes.liked: — cleanliness and hospitality of the staff

reviews.text: Our family has recently returned from a wonderful vacation in Williamsburg. We stayed at the Hampton Inn and Suites and were very pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: the hampton inn and suites was perfect for our family

likes.liked: — everything was clean and the beds were very comfortable

reviews.text: We stayed in a Queen suite which suited our family of five. There were 2 queen size beds and a pull out couch. The beds were really comfortable. The only negative was that the pull-out couch was not the most comfortable but... none of them really are. It was fine for my 15 yr old son though.
reviews.title: nice place, not so friendly staff

reviews.text: The room was extra large with a sitting area and a large screen t.v. There was a handy wet bar in the room as well with a mini-fridge and microwave. The room was very clean and well kept.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay in Williamsburg

reviews.text: The bathroom was nice as well and also very clean.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: A hot breakfast was included in the stay. There were three kinds of cereal, muffins, donuts, eggs and sausage, biscuits, one morning they offered French toast and on another day or two the hot breakfast was an egg and bacon biscuit pizza. They also served coffee, tea, hot chocolate and juices. This breakfast was perfect for our family and saved us a lot of money.
reviews.title: NIce Get-A-Way

reviews.text: The 2 queen suite with a pull-out sofa bed is a great deal. The room is about twice as large as a normal hotel room. The two queens are very comfortable with down comforter bedding. The pull-out sofa (either double or queen size, I am not sure which) was also comfortable for pull-out bedding. In addition to the separate sink and bath, the room has a wet bar with microwave, coffee maker, and small refrigerator. The room was very clean and quiet. We had an early spring price of $85/night (great deal) but I would have been happy to pay twice as much. Hotel staff were very friendly and made some great meal recommendations. We enjoyed our stay here very much.
reviews.title: very comfortable hotel for 5

reviews.text: If recent reviews of this hotel had been bad, I would have skipped this review as I stayed there last year and simply forgot to come back and review the property. However, we had a wonderful experience and I wanted to share the best points of our stay.
reviews.title: Good value and a great stay

likes.disliked: — The elevators are right next to the indoor pool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were a family of five with three children, but there were all ages at the hotel. This particular Hampton Inn actually offered a larger AARP discount than the Hampton Inn in town. I preferred this Hampton location over the other as it was in a very quiet area. There are plenty of restaurants in town within a short driving distance. If you're walking, your choices are very limited.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was spotless. The breakfast bar was great and was kept refilled constantly by the friendly staff. Minor complaints...the dining room is not large enough when the hotel is busy and the elevators are in a hallway right next to the indoor pool. We were dodging one particular group of kids every time we came out of the elevators onto wet floors, which were cleaned up fairly regularly by the staff.
reviews.title: Great Stay!!

reviews.text: The hotel is right down the street from Colonial Williamsburg, but I wouldn't recommend walking as you do a LOT of walking at the park and parking is free (buy tickets ahead of time online, if possible, and avoid the line during busy weeks).
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel Good Value

reviews.text: You won't get luxury, but this is a solid selection for families. The room was clean, the beds comfortable. The construction is fairly new. The breakfast bar wasn't fancy, but covered all the bases. Indoor pool, decent exercise room, and whirlpool. A very short drive from the Colonial Williamsburg Visitor Center. Service was excellent.
reviews.title: Great family hotel

likes.liked: — Great service, especially at the breakfast bar.
likes.disliked: — Only one or two restaurants within walking distance.

reviews.text: We just returned from a week-long stay at this hotel in Williamsburg. We enjoyed it ; we had a suite with 2 queen beds, and the sleeper sofa. The room was what I consider "extra large", and my son had no complaints about the sleeper sofa, but he is 10, and pretty much sleeps anywhere.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: The bedding was very nice, and the fridge & microwave definitely came in handy for us. Nice counter area with a small sink over the fridge where we kept our snacks & lots of room to warm up our left-overs.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel- must stay!

reviews.text: All the staff went out of their way to be friendly and helpful to us with directions and recommendations for resturants. Housekeeping never bothered us as long as we had the "resting" sign on the door.
reviews.title: good stay

reviews.text: The breakfast was okay, not great; we stuck with the yogurt, fruit & muffins. The "hot' entree was not very appetizing. Location was a bit off the "new" tourist loop, but still very close to everything.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, not so nice staff

likes.liked: — I guess that it is a new property...that is IT
likes.disliked: — The staff....very unfriendly and unwelcoming. Sorry to bother them!!

aka: Hampton Inn & Suites Williamsburg Historic District Hotel
description: This spacious two queen bedroom studio suite includes all modern amenities including lap desk, iron/board, coffee maker, safe, kitchen area, sofa pull out and cloud nine bedding.
